column4: hey guys, I'm trying to install vmware server 1.0.5, when I run vmware-config.pl I get the following error during the module buildup: http://rafb.net/p/11s4xA96.html   ---- any ideas how to fix this?
You need a vmware-any-any patch to make the VMware kernel modules build against newer kernels
what's that patch? where do I get it and how do I apply it?
Google for "vmware-any-any"...  it's an unofficial patch (produced by one of the VMware developers, I think)
is it hard to apply?
No, it's pretty easy...  extract the tarball and run the runme.pl script within, and then run vmware-configure again
You need vmware-any-any-update116 (older versions won't work with 2.6.24)
lemme try
you rock! it worked! :)
Thanks a lot!
any ideas how to run the vmware console?
should be just "vmware"
http://rafb.net/p/FCumxM64.html  -- any ideas?
I did install gcc-4.3
dunno about that, sorry, but installing gcc-4.3 isn't likely to help; this is a library issue
The problem is that it's using a version of libgcc_s.so provided by VMware itself, but a copy of libstdc++ provided by Ubuntu, and the former is too old for the latter
damn :(
VMware ships a bunch of bundled libraries to try to be independent of the library versions on the system where it's installed, but apparently that's not working quite right in this case
The VMware support forums would be the best place to look for info on that
nifty, though personally I'd check the support forums anyway for a less-klugey solution
will do, thanks a lot for your help!
